abstract.t: The Service Location Protocol provides a scalable framework for thediscovery and selection of network services. Using this protocol,computers using the Internet need little or no static configurationof network services for network based applications. This isespecially important as computers become more portable, and usersless tolerant or able to fulfill the demands of network systemadministration. This document updates SLPv2, adding clarificationsand removing features which were neither widely implemented or deemeduseful.
